name: Adriano Celentano
comments: Singer, songwriter, and actor. One of the earliest Italian rock 'n' roll singers, he is nicknamed "Il molleggiato" ("springy") for his stage moves, inspired by Jerry Lewis . In December 1961 he founded Clan Celentano : not just an independent record label, but (at least in theory) a close-knit circle of like-minded singers, songwriters, musicians, friends and relatives. Thanks to "The Clan", he developed a unique style, blending rock 'n' roll, classic pop, cabaret music and topical songs. Throughout the 1970's and 1980's, Celentano starred in (and sometimes directed) a string of successful comedy films, and more recently he has hosted a series of television specials. Outspoken and unpredictable, he was the first Italian pop artist to address environmental issues with his signature song "I ragazzi della via Gluck", but also critical towards the hippy movement and labor-union strikes.

When Mosley formed his own band in 1938, he featured his slide saxophone and became known as ''the man with the funny horn.'' He mostly played in the New York area into the late 1970s.

name: Lisa Moscatiello

She performs as a solo artist, in a duo with cellist Fred Lieder, and is the lead singer for Jennifer Cutting's Ocean Orchestra and for the electronica project Arthur Loves Plastic. She is the former lead singer for Celtic fusion bands Whirligig and The New St. George and has recorded and toured with fiddler Rosie Shipley.

name: Chet Baker
comments: Jazz trumpet and flugelhorn player and vocalist.  Baker was associated with the west coast jazz movement. He became addicted to heroin in the 1950s and struggled with drug problems the remainder of his life, doing time in prison, including over a year in Italy on drug charges.  In 1968, Baker was severely beaten, and his teeth were all broken, causing him to lose the ability to play trumpet.  He ultimately got dentures and eventually developed the ability to play trumpet again. From 1973 until 1982, Baker lived with singer Ruth Young , and from 1978 until his death lived primarily in Europe. He fell from the second story of a hotel in Amsterdam and died from head wounds at the age of 59.

name: Maria Karnilova
comments: Dancer and actress born in Hartford, Connecticut and the daughter of emigrants from Tsarist Russia. She made her Broadway debut in 1946 in "Call Me Mister". She won the Tony Award for Best Featured Actress in a Musical for the original 1964 production of "Fiddler on the Roof" starring Zero Mostel and was nominated as Best Actress in a Musical for "Zorba" (1968). She was married to actor George S. Irving from 1948 until her death in Manhattan at the age of 80 in 2001.
